Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Earn your BSN online.

The baccalaureate Completion Nursing Program at Brigham Young University–Idaho is designed for the individual with a current license as a Registered Nurse, who desires to expand employment opportunities and enhance nursing knowledge. This program can be completed in three full-time semesters or six part-time semesters. Students enrolling in this program online should be ready to apply themselves  to the nursing philosophy and practice.

    What will I study?

    • Pathophysiology
    • Nursing Research
    • Advanced Medical Surgery
    • Nursing Leadership

    University Catalog

    How will my transfer credit be evaluated?

    BYU-Idaho strives to make the most of your transfer credit while maintaining the integrity of the program. During your orientation class you will work with your advisor to create a graduation plan that maximizes your transfer credits and map out all the courses you need to take to graduate.

    • Transfer Credit Guidelines
    • Course Equivalencies

    Have questions?

    We're ready to talk! Call us at (866) 672-2984, or email us at onlinelearning@byui.edu, or text your question to (208) 557-4142
